action.action-desc: Mr. Cohen introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend title 49, United States Code, to require Amtrak to submit to Congress an annual report with respect to the implementation of certain recommendations of the Amtrak Food and Beverage Working Group for improving the food and beverage service of Amtrak, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Train Furtherance of Outstanding Onboard Dining Act or the Train FOOD Act.

section.header: Oversight of implementation by Amtrak of recommendations of Amtrak Food and Beverage Working Group

subsection.text: Section 24321 of title 49, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsection (d) as subsection (f); and
by inserting after subsection (c) the following new subsections:

Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of the Train Furtherance of Outstanding Onboard Dining Act, Amtrak shall establish an advisory committee to provide internal review with respect to the implementation by Amtrak of the recommendations contained in the report under subsection (b).
The advisory committee shall consist of individuals representing—

subparagraph.text: the labor organizations representing Amtrak employees who prepare or provide on-board food and beverage service;
nonprofit organizations representing Amtrak passengers; and
States that are providing funding for State-supported routes.

paragraph.text: The advisory committee shall terminate on the date on which Amtrak submits the final report required under subsection (e)(1).

Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of the Train Furtherance of Outstanding Onboard Dining Act and annually thereafter until such time as all recommendations contained in the report under subsection (b) are implemented by Amtrak or determined by Amtrak to be impractical or impossible to implement, Amtrak shall—

subparagraph.text: submit to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives a report on the status of the implementation of each such recommendation; and
make the report available on a publicly accessible website of Amtrak.

paragraph.text: Each report under paragraph (1) shall include—

subparagraph.text: a description of the progress made by Amtrak in implementing each recommendation contained in the report under subsection (b);
identification of each such recommendation for which implementation is complete;
identification of each such recommendation that Amtrak determines to be impractical or impossible to implement;
for each recommendation identified under subparagraph (C)—

clause.text: the justification for the determination that the recommendation is impractical or impossible to implement; and
if the justification is all, or in part, attributable to insufficient funding, an estimated cost of implementing the recommendation;

subparagraph.text: a description of how, if at all, food and beverage service of Amtrak has changed—

clause.text: if in the initial report, since the date of enactment of the Train Furtherance of Outstanding Onboard Dining Act; and
if in a subsequent report, since the date on which the previous report was finalized; and

subparagraph.text: comments submitted by the advisory committee to Amtrak regarding the information included under subparagraphs (A) through (E).

subsection.text: Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Comptroller General of the United States shall submit to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation of the Senate and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives a report describing the progress made by Amtrak in implementing each recommendation contained in the report under section 24321(b) of title 49, United States Code.
